column4: Hi. I need a C++ development environment beside Anjuta. Does anyone know of a good one?
Hi. I need a C++ development environment beside Anjuta. Does anyone know of a good one?
eclipse + cdt is good but very slow compared to anjuta.
what is the synaptic package name?
what is the synaptic package name?

eclipse I think, it runs on java. you can install the cdt from inside eclipse (updates). ubuntu installs gnu java implementations with eclipse though (dependencies) so I would recommend to jsut download eclipse from the official site and so on.
thanks
mind that eclipse is suboptimal for that anjuta is far nicer for C/C++
you could also try kdevelop
the only problem with anjuta is that whenever I compile a simple hello world program, it doesnt run
how would I be able to run a program made by anjuta:
did you manage to compile/run it yourself on the command line?
after building the program, I saw the executable saved in my home directory, but when i double click it, nothing happens.
it's just a simple hello world program from anjuta
try running it from a console/terminal to see what error it gives
there is no error
it works fine in the terminal, printing "Hello World"
how do I get it to run just by clicking it?
probably you need to set "run in terminal" somewhere on it
thx
I can run the program in the terminal from anjuta, but not after it's been compiled.Do you happen to know how to set it to run from the terminal?
nah, maybe you can right click on it and set it's properties, or create an application launcher that runs it and has run-in-terminal ticked
how do i create a launcher?
how do i create a launcher?
